Package emissary.kff

Class KffMemcached

java.lang.Object
emissary.kff.KffMemcached
All Implemented Interfaces:
KffFilter
public class KffMemcached extends Object implements KffFilter
KffMemcached checks Emissary hashes against a set of external memcached servers. If a given Emissary hash does not hit in memcached, it is added to the memcached. The value stored is however the input is identified (notionally, some type of id). Only one type of hash can be checked against memcached (i.e. SHA-1...not SHA-1 and SHA-256). See the PREF_ALG configuration option. If the option MEMCACHED_STORE_ID_DUPE is set to true, if an Emissary hash already exists in memcached, the id will also be loaded into memcached as a key. The purpose of this is for other follow-on processes (non-Emissary) to query memcached and determine if a given id is a duplicate (i.e. if it is present). If a server goes down, this code will wait and try to reconnect with increasingly long intervals between retries. Under this mode of operation, it is expected someone will bring the server back online. Configuration file options are: MEMCACHED_SERVER: one line for each server, optional : separated port MEMCACHED_AGEOFF: how long to hold an object in memcached before expiring MEMCACHED_OP_TIMEOUT_MILLIS: how long to wait before timing out a memcached operation MEMCACHED_IGNORE_VALUE_PATTERN: do not store values that contain this pattern (non-regexO MEMCACHED_FAILURE_MODE: what to do in case of server failure MEMCACHED_STORE_ID_DUPE: boolean to store the id if it's hash is already contained in memcached PREF_ALG: Which Emissary hash to use as the key stored in memcached

    • KffMemcached

      public KffMemcached(String filename, String filterName, KffFilter.FilterType ftype) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      filename - Unused
      filterName - Name of the filter (typically sent in by KffChainLoader)
      ftype - Filter type (again, sent in by KffChainLoader)
      Throws:
      IOException - is thrown if either the file cannot be read of memcached cannot be contacted

    • KffMemcached

      public KffMemcached(String testIdWithSpaces, String filterName, KffFilter.FilterType duplicate, @Nullable net.spy.memcached.MemcachedClient testClient) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      testIdWithSpaces - Unused
      filterName - Name of the filter (typically sent in by KffChainLoader)
      duplicate - Filter type (again, sent in by KffChainLoader)
      testClient - Memcached client to be used if specified (will instantiate a client if null)
      Throws:
      IOException - is thrown if either the file cannot be read of memcached cannot be contacted

  • Method Details

    • check

      public boolean check(String id, ChecksumResults sums) throws Exception
      Contact the memcached server and lookup the hash. If it is found, then return true. If it is not found, store it and return false. If it matches a special ignore pattern, return false. If the server is down or any other problems throw an exception
      Specified by:
      check in interface KffFilter
      Throws:
      Exception
